tool.name: metaSPAdes
tool.command: ## A real command looks like: spades.py -k 21,33,55,77,99,127 --careful -1 Y.fastq.gz -2 X.fastq.gz -t 24 -o output spades.py -o . --disable-gzip-output --meta $onlyassembler -t \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-16} #if not $kmer_choice.auto_kmer_choice: -k "$kmer_choice.kmers" #end if ## Sequence files #set num=1 #if str( $lib_type ) == "paired_end": #set prefix = 'pe' #end if --$prefix$num-$orientation #for $file in $files #if $file.file_type.type == "separate" --$prefix$num-1 fastq:$file.file_type.fwd_reads --$prefix$num-2 fastq:$file.file_type.rev_reads #elif $file.file_type.type == "interleaved" --$prefix$num-12 fastq:$file.file_type.interleaved_reads #elif $file.file_type.type == "paired-collection" --$prefix$num-1 fastq:$file.file_type.fastq_collection.forward --$prefix$num-2 fastq:$file.file_type.fastq_collection.reverse #end if #end for

param.name: onlyassembler
param.label: Run only assembly? (without read error correction)

param.name: auto_kmer_choice
param.label: Automatically choose k-mer values
param.help: k-mer choices can be chosen by SPAdes instead of being entered manually

param.name: kmers
param.label: K-mers to use, separated by commas
param.help: Comma-separated list of k-mer sizes to be used (all values must be odd, less than 128, listed in ascending order, and smaller than the read length). The default value is 21,33,55.
